src:
Harden faz 36 pontos e Rockets vencem Golden State Warriors
Já o Milwaukee Bucks bateu o Los Angeles Clippers fora de casa
07 Nov 2019, 19:46 by Estadão Conteúdo
O péssimo começo de temporada do Golden State Warriors foi ampliado na rodada de quarta-feira (6). A equipe da Califórnia sofreu a quarta derrota em seis jogos no campeonato ao perder para o Houston Rockets por 129 a 112, fora de casa, sofrendo com mais uma grande atuação de James Harden.
O astro fechou a partida com 36 pontos e 13 assistências pelos Rockets, tendo convertido 6 de 16 arremessos de três pontos. Assim, Harden vai melhorando a sua precisão nas tentativas de longe, pois só havia conseguindo êxito em 17 de 79 nos seis primeiros jogos da temporada - agora, então, acertou 13 de 32 nos últimos dois duelos.
Russell Westbrook somou 18 pontos, oito rebotes e seis assistências. P.J. Tucker contribuiu com 22 pontos e 11 rebotes, Clint Capela acumulou 19 pontos e 16 rebotes, e Austin Rivers fez 12 pontos ao converter as suas quatro tentativas de três para os Rockets, agora com cinco triunfos em oito duelos.
Alec Burks liderou o Golden State com 28 pontos. Eric Paschall fez 19 pontos e Glenn Robinson III acrescentou 15 pontos e 11 rebotes. Já sofrendo com as lesões dos Splash Brothers - Stephen Curry (fratura na mão) e Klay Thompson (cirurgia no joelho) - e a perda de Kevin Durant, os Warriors atuaram sem D'Angelo Russell (torção no tornozelo) e Draymond Green (lesão no dedo) pelo terceiro jogo consecutivo.
Fora de casa, o Milwaukee Bucks superou o Los Angeles Clippers por 129 a 124. Giannis Antetokounmpo somou 38 pontos e 16 rebotes, George Hill marcou 24 ao sair do banco de reservas e o Milwaukee repeliu todas as ameaças para vencer o time de Los Angeles pela quarta partida consecutiva. Os Bucks converteram 18 arremessos de três, liderados por seis de Hill.
Antetokounmpo quase conseguiu um "triple-double" ao dar nove assistências. Ele somou pelo menos dez rebotes e cinco assistências em cada um dos oito primeiros duelos desta temporada, sendo o primeiro jogador a fazer isso desde a temporada 1972/1973.
Os Clippers pouparam Kawhi Leonard do primeiro de dois jogos em dias seguidos como mandante - o time vai jogar contra o Portland Trail Blazers na noite desta quinta-feira e agora está com cinco triunfos em oito duelos.
Montrezl Harrell fez 34 pontos, a maior produção ofensiva da sua carreira, e capturou 13 rebotes em sua primeira partida como titular na temporada. Lou Williams acrescentou 34 pontos e 11 assistências, e Patrick Beverley fez 20 pontos e dez rebotes na primeira derrota em casa dos Clippers.
Liderados por Hill e Kyle Korver, com 14 pontos, os reservas dos Bucks superaram o banco dos Clippers por 47 a 20. Foram, portanto, determinantes para a sexta vitória em oito compromissos nesta temporada.
Com 24 pontos e oito assistências de Donovan Mitchell e 16 rebotes e 14 pontos de Rudy Gobert, o Utah Jazz superou o Philadelphia 76ers por 106 a 104, em Salt Lake City. Já Raulzinho jogou por 30 minutos pelo time da Filadélfia, com 11 pontos, quatro assistências e três rebotes.
O Memphis Grizzlies superou o Minnesota Timberwolves por 137 a 121 com 21 pontos de Dillon Brooks, 26 de Ja Morant e cinco pontos, três rebotes e duas assistências de Bruno Caboclo, que atuou por 13 minutos.
O Toronto Raptors venceu o Sacramento Kings por 124 a 120, no Canadá, com 23 pontos e 13 rebotes de Pascal Siakam e 24 pontos de Kyle Lowry. O Dallas Mavericks bateu o Orlando Magic por 107 a 106 em noite de 27 pontos, sete rebotes e sete assistências de Luka Doncic.
O Detroit Pistons fez 122 a 102 no New York Knicks com 14 pontos de Tony Snell e 26 pontos e 12 rebotes de Andre Drummond. Com 19 pontos de Doug McDermott e 17 rebotes e 13 pontos de Domantas Sabonis, o Indiana Pacers bateu por 121 a 106 o Washington Wizards. Já o Chicago Bull venceu o Atlanta Hawks por 113 a 93 com 27 pontos, oito assistências e sete rebotes de Tomas Satoransky.
Confira os jogos da rodada de quinta-feira (7) da NBA:Charlotte Hornets x Boston CelticsSan Antonio Spurs x Oklahoma City ThunderPhoenix Suns x Miami HeatLos Angeles Clippers x Portland Trail Blazers
text:
Harden scores 36 points and Rockets win Golden State Warriors
Milwaukee Bucks beat Los Angeles Clippers away
07 Nov 2019, 19:46 by Estadão Contents
The bad start of the Golden State Warriors season was extended in the round of Wednesday (6). The California team suffered their fourth defeat in six league games when they lost to Houston Rockets 129-112 away from home, suffering another major performance from James Harden.
The star ended the match with 36 points and 13 assists for the Rockets, having converted 6 of 16 three-point shots. Thus, Harden has improved his accuracy in long-range attempts as he had only been successful in 17 of 79 in the first six games of the season - now, then, has hit 13 of 32 in the last two duels.
Russell Westbrook added 18 points, eight rebounds and six assists. P.J. Tucker contributed 22 points and 11 rebounds, Clint Chapel racked up 19 points and 16 rebounds, and Austin Rivers scored 12 points by converting his four attempts from three to the Rockets, now with five wins in eight duels.
Alec Burks led the Golden State with 28 points. Eric Paschall scored 19 points and Glenn Robinson III added 15 points and 11 rebounds. Already suffering from Splash Brothers injuries - Stephen Curry (hand fracture) and Klay Thompson (knee surgery) - and the loss of Kevin Durant, the Warriors acted without D'Angelo Russell (ankle sprain) and Draymond Green (injury) on the finger) for the third consecutive game.
Away from home, Milwaukee Bucks beat the Los Angeles Clippers 129 to 124. Giannis Antetokounmpo added 38 points and 16 rebounds, George Hill scored 24 on the bench and Milwaukee fought off all threats to beat the Los Angeles team. for the fourth consecutive match. The Bucks converted 18 throws from three, led by Hill's six.
Antetokounmpo almost got a triple double by giving nine assists. He has scored at least ten rebounds and five assists in each of the first eight duels this season, being the first player to do so since the 1972/1973 season.
The Clippers have spared Kawhi Leonard from their first two games in a row in a row - the team will play against the Portland Trail Blazers on Thursday night and are now five wins in eight duels.
Montrezl Harrell scored 34 points, the biggest offensive production of his career, and captured 13 rebounds in his first starting lineup of the season. Lou Williams added 34 points and 11 assists, and Patrick Beverley scored 20 points and ten rebounds in the Clippers' first home defeat.
Led by Hill and Kyle Korver, with 14 points, the Bucks reserves topped the Clippers' bench by 47-20. They were therefore decisive for their sixth win in eight appointments this season.
With 24 points and eight assists from Donovan Mitchell and 16 rebounds and 14 points from Rudy Gobert, Utah Jazz beat the Philadelphia 76ers 106-104 in Salt Lake City. Raulzinho played for 30 minutes for the Philadelphia team with 11 points, four assists and three rebounds.
Memphis Grizzlies beat the Minnesota Timberwolves 137-121 with 21 points from Dillon Brooks, 26 from Ja Morant and five points, three rebounds and two assists from Bruno Caboclo, who played for 13 minutes.
The Toronto Raptors beat the Sacramento Kings 124 to 120 in Canada with 23 points and 13 rebounds from Pascal Siakam and 24 points from Kyle Lowry. The Dallas Mavericks beat Orlando Magic 107-106 on a 27-point night, seven rebounds and seven assists from Luka Doncic.
The Detroit Pistons scored 122-102 at the New York Knicks with 14 points from Tony Snell and 26 points and 12 rebounds from Andre Drummond. With 19 points from Doug McDermott and 17 rebounds and 13 points from Domantas Sabonis, the Indiana Pacers beat the Washington Wizards 121 to 106. Chicago Bull beat Atlanta Hawks 113-93 with 27 points, eight assists and seven rebounds from Tomas Satoransky.
